hypothesis_content.title: Stablecoin Trading Pair Volatility Arbitrage
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS regimes, stablecoin trading pairs (USDT/USDC) exhibit predictable mean reversion when their price deviates > 0.5% from parity, with reversion completing within 24 hours 80% of the time.
hypothesis_content.rationale: During market stress, stablecoin arbitrage becomes highly profitable as market makers withdraw liquidity. The 1:1 redemption guarantee creates a hard bound, but temporary dislocations occur due to funding rate imbalances, exchange-specific demand, and regulatory concerns. High volume ensures sufficient liquidity for execution.
entry_conditions: Monitor USDT/USDC price on 3 major exchanges (Binance, Coinbase, Kraken)
Calculate volume-weighted average price across exchanges
Enter long cheaper stablecoin/short more expensive when spread > 0.5%
Only execute if aggregate stablecoin trading volume > $1B in past 24h
Require at least 2 exchanges showing same directional mispricing

exit_conditions.take_profit: Position closes when spread narrows to < 0.1%
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Position closes if spread widens to > 1.0%
exit_conditions.time_exit: Position closes after 48 hours regardless of P&L

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 20% of trades hit 1.0% stop-loss. Execution slippage exceeds 50% of expected profit. Strategy fails during regulatory announcements affecting specific stablecoins.
